result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Penalty - OWI Cause Injury (2+)] and PAC Cause Injury (2+) .218 [Modifiers: Penalty - OWI Cause Injury (2+)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Penalty - OWI Cause Injury (2+)] and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) .218 [Modifiers: Penalty - OWI Cause Injury (2+)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Amber L. Rhodes was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Penalty - OWI Cause Injury (2+)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay $1,757.00 fine and costs.
Defendant to pay restitution and surcharge in an amount to be determined; restitution hearing to be scheduled.  $1,000.00 posted to be released to victim, J.B.
Huber granted for 90 days jail - not granted for additional 14 days jail imposed & stayed.

No consumption of alcohol.

Comply with any conditions per agent.

Complete orientation for OWI 2nd Program no later than September 10, 2015.

Comply with and complete OWI 2nd Program.

timeConds.notes:
90 days jail imposed - with Huber/work release privileges.

Additional 14 days jail imposed and stayed - without Huber - Stayed if Defendant complies with OWI 2nd Program.  Review hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 @ 10:00 a.m.
